abstract: The $39.5 billion profit topped the previous record for a U.S. company, which Exxon set in 2005.
snippet: The $39.5 billion profit topped the previous record for a U.S. company, which Exxon set in 2005.
lead_paragraph: HOUSTON, Feb. 1  Exxon Mobil reported a record annual profit today but a modest decline in fourth-quarter earnings because of falling oil and gas prices. Meanwhile, its competitor Royal Dutch Shell reported an unexpected rise in quarterly earnings, a sign that the industry is still going strong.

headline.main: Exxon Sets Record on Annual Profits

abstract: Exxon Mobil Capital Spending Rises, But Not As Rapidly As Its Sharebuybacks
snippet: Exxon Mobil Capital Spending Rises, But Not As Rapidly As Its Sharebuybacks
